intro: Caryophyllus plumarius, commonly known as the plumrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. Caryophyllus plumarius is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained, sandy soils.
